title: Case Study: Stiff Person Syndrome in a 45-Year-Old Female
clinical_history: A 45-year-old female, Sarah, presented with a 6-month history of progressive stiffness and rigidity in her trunk and lower limbs. She reported difficulty walking and maintaining balance due to stiffness in her legs and back. The symptoms started with intermittent episodes of stiffness in her legs, which gradually worsened and became constant. She also experiences episodes of severe stiffness that can last for hours, making it difficult for her to move or perform daily activities.
aggrevating_factors: Prolonged standing, walking, or physical activity; stress and anxiety
picture: A 24-hour picture showing stiffness and rigidity in the trunk and lower limbs, with difficulty walking and maintaining balance
past_history: History of autoimmune disorders (thyroiditis), and a family history of autoimmune diseases
medical_history: Diagnosed with type 1 diabetes and autoimmune thyroiditis
personal_history: Married with two children, works as an accountant, and has a sedentary lifestyle
imaging: MRI of the spine and brain: normal; EMG and nerve conduction studies: normal; Blood tests: positive for GAD65 antibodies
